author: {'steamid': '76561198162864353', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1506041752}
review:
So I bought this game as part of the most recent Steam Sale, I'm a huge supporter of the games made by Idea Factory and Compile Heart.

The game was going well up until I get to the sub mission involving fighting IF and then the dragon afterwards. When it got to the Dragon's first turn, as soon as it did its attack, all sound cut out.

Music, SFX, Voice. All of it, just silent.

The game continued to play normally despite the sound, but as I continued on in the fight against the dragon, I ended up having a huge graphical slowdown. Just the game and nothing else. Internet Browser still worked fine, every other application worked fine. It was just this game.

I'm still recommending it as a fan of the Neptunia series, but I hope this isn't a continuing issue.

Also, I didn't notice, but the achievements never popped up until I closed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279660669', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1596391249}
review:
[strike]Lastation Noire的房间里，Nep正想找Noire做一些不可描述的事情，可是却看到了Noire却在和男主做不可描述的事情。[/strike]
[strike]Nep（愤怒的）：Noire你在干什么？我...我...我要......[/strike]
[strike]男主：看我的，原谅帽![/strike]
[strike]（啪！）[/strike]
[strike]Nep:我，我，我，我要......我要原谅你们[/strike]
[strike]Nep:我要去Amazon.nep买一顶绿色的帽子[/strike]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+作为一款战棋游戏，设计还是延续了经典的玩法
=如果你觉得你不够萌，找Idea Factory就对了
+与许多成功的战棋游戏一样有自己的核心点：高度、后背、元素、[strike]Peak一下再放个技能[/strike]
-与地雷社其他作品一样，用球做的CG，用脚做的优化。超频的750Ti还会出现掉帧（平时不会，最多波动2-5帧，但是你锁帧30的情况下相当影响视觉体验）
-人物腿画崩了，膝盖没有注意细节，大小腿之间很明显的拼接痕迹（膝盖莫名疼了一下）
+场景的布置很准确的反映出了角色的性格特点
-全成就的时间足够让你在CSGO里从白银1打到黄金4（如果不是全成就党绝对不要尝试打完）
-游戏中有很多机制使用一次后就再没出现过，却还要单独的说明和使用（Resta战的火车，Lid战的定时炸弹）
+虽然这些机制只出现了一次，强行增加容量，不过确实让人眼前一亮
+没有出现前几作格斗游戏中那自带高斯模糊的视角了
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.论奶妈，我不服Plutia（奶量不够还很S），也不服Compa（地雷社你一天不出四女神ONLINE我一天不用你们家看板娘），只服Resta。不仅没有三年起步最高无期，奶量还十足（一口满）
2.Lid你敢不敢再傻一点，偷看人家Noire洗澡不打掩护也就算了，还不小心摔进去，还让她暴打一顿
3.整个作品中都在强调高度对作战的重要性。高处攻击地处几乎不会被闪避，并有伤害加成。地处攻击高处很容易被闪避。高度差2格以上摔下来就会受到伤害并直接终止她的回合
4.说闪退的，别用[b]某大妈[/b]的机翻补丁了。存档文件在游戏根目录下，整个游戏移动硬盘（U盘）打包带走即可
5.相信我，如果想快速结束战斗最好的方法是集群互刷LP值，然后对准目标一个SP.Move，收工结算战斗

author: {'steamid': '76561198100769008', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1346, 'last_played': 1518025765}
review:
[h1]Make the Lastation great again![/h1]

Ответвление серии Neptunia посвящённое Нуар - олицитворению PlayStation. В отличии от двух других Hack 'n' Slash спин-оффов, данная игра - TBS.

Сюжет рассказывает о том, как безмерная гордыня богини привела её к краху (в основном из-за наивной глупости), как её спас Секретарь и вместе они пошли возвращать Нуар её доброе имя. 

Кстати о Секретаре - это аватар игрока. Из этого следует множество забавных (иногда и пошлых) ситуаций направленных по эту сторону монитора. В обязанности Секретаря входят закупка/создание предметов, обустройство комнаты Нуар (за  очки полученые с покупок) и разбор писем фанатов - аналога телевикторины NepStation из старших игр.

Геймплей. Игра являет собой достаточно простую пошаговую тактическую стратегию где важен человеческий фактор больше чем прокачка. Под контроль даётся до 7-ми девушек - всего их 22, причём 18 из них - новые персонажи в серии, нигде больше не встречавшиеся.

Геймплейные особенности :
[list]
[*]Элементы. Лёд > огонь > ветер > молния. Любой тип можно снарядить кому угодно с целью побороть конкретный вид врага или вскрыть особый сундук. Так же можно их не использовать во избежание уязвимости.
[*]Шкала Флирта (Lily Rank). Крайне опасная в умелых руках вещь. Когда бойцы используя приём находятся впритык к друг другу, они усиливают этот самый приём, снижают на него затраты SP и заполняют тем самым шкалу. Чем ближе счётчик к 100%, тем ниже затраты SP на любую магию. Имея 100% заряд, можно исполнить особую способность, как правило с большим уроном, а если сделать это в окружении подруг, то требования могут быть и 70% шкалы, которая к тому же восполнится наполовину после применения. Используя с умом можно выносить неприятеля без потерь. 
[*]Взаимодействие с окружением. Различные переключатели, лифты, порталы, ловушки и таскание ящиков для подъёма вверх - карты почти всегда имеют полезные для использования предметы.
[/list]

  Каждая сюжетная миссия отличается от другой, задачами и способом их выполнения. Доведётся спасти девушку, защитить груз, обезвредить бомбы, сбежать с поле боя или устроить соревнование по фарму монстров (лол!).  Даже типичное "Убей всех" может быть обставлено рядом ограничений - то пол под напряжением, то пушки обстреливают. Все уровни можно переиграть в симуляции, с целью подкачаться и собрать сундуки. Доп. Квесты предлагают в основном геноцид усиленных/заменённых монстров на уже пройдённых картах.

Внешний вид и ПК-порт. Игра выполнена в стиле Чиби и выглядит мило. Сам порт, увы не так хорош - как всегда тяжко играется на клавиатуре и имеет привычку иногда вылетать (3 вылета за 20 часов) - сохраняйтесь почаще. В остальном - всё нормально.

Должен сказать, что данная "побочная" игра Нептунии мне понравилась больше остальных спин-оффов. К тому же хотелось бы видеть внедрённых персонажей в следующих играх серии - больно уж хорошо они получились.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174053214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1494710783}
review:
We'll start with a quick summary for this one: if you haven't played a Neptune game yet, this is not the first one you should pick (unless you really like strategy rpgs and dislike jrpgs).  I'll still recommend the first Hyperdimension if you haven't tried one at all.  If you have played them and love the games and the characters and interactions, then this has more of the same fun wackiness that is Nep-Nep, but the actual gameplay may feel more of a grind and 'in the way' of seeing the story and interactions.

You actually play the role of a guy that is in the Nep-Nep world, and you end up helping Noire out with a situation, and from there you continue to follow Noire and help her deal with what's happening in Gamindustry.  And from there, the story continues: not everyone likes this kind of 'twist' to a Nep-Nep game, so that's why I mention it.  I didn't mind the idea, but the interactions between Noire and the 'player' are about 50/50: half funny, and half just awfully awkward.  There are also a bunch of new characters introduced, and the interactions with these characters are MUCH better and interesting for the most part: this is the best part of the game.

The story is about the same quality as most Neptune stories.  The music IS the same as other Neptunes (actually a lot is recycled, but if you played any more than one Neptune game you know what it's going to be like).  The gameplay... well... perhaps it's because I don't have much time to sit down and play these games, but it felt really slow and frustrating (I hate crates and stacking them to reach areas that are too high, and also traps in general: others probably like that it adds variety to the missions.  If you really like strategy games, this will be a fun thing: if you just want to see the interactions like I do... well, prepare yourself!)

And the final thing: Neptune games are known to have lots of grinding to them, especially if you love achievements and unlocking everything.  If this is you, then this game is even MORE grinding than most other Neptune games: I bypassed a great deal of achievements because... well, I lack patience, lol.  

It has enough fun and humor and interactions for me to recommend the game, but I'd wait for a sale for this one.  I'd imagine most other Neptune games would be a better pick to get while you wait for a sale here.  That's if you are looking for *another* Neptune game: if you haven't tried one, pick the first one first!

review: One of the best SRPGs I've played since Fire Emblem. The game is as difficult as you want it to be making it great for all skill levels. There is a lot of grinding though especially if you're trying to make the weapon plans. Love the new characters and the chibi style design though sad that Uni isn't in it even though Noire is the main character. This might be my favorite Neptunia game in the series so far or at the very least tied at the top with Rebirth 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106247011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1491024840}
review: 不喜欢战斗模式。而且为什么有男主啊。喜欢Q版人物而且不介意男主的真爱厨可以打折的时候入手

author: {'steamid': '76561198166321567', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2847, 'last_played': 1491755222}
review:
本作身为外传作品，加入了大量的general角色和男主（？）[strike] 我倒是不在乎这个，男主和Saori在一起感觉不错	[/strike]，剧情方面和本传作品一样欢乐无限，采用了萌萌的Q版建模和怀旧式立体格子回合制系统。剧情和人设都可以给满分，问题在于战斗系统和收集要素。
战斗系统节奏过慢，加上复杂的地图设计、高度系统、宝箱属性克制等因素，导致即便开启了全部的技能特效跳过选项，每一场战斗依然很消耗玩家的耐心。
boss战回顾的设计带给玩家更多的是痛苦，你会发现好不容易打完了一场麻烦冗长的boss战，然后又要再打一遍。[spoiler] 我在打Vio和Blanc的boss战中完全丧失了耐心，超浪费时间的地图设计，还要两连战，第二战还有回合限制，还在好不容易摸到Vid面前之后被她恶心的大变豆腐技能生生拖掉7个回合导致战败，半个小时完全浪费，游戏体验简直不能更差。	[/spoiler]
LP值的设定是一个亮点，相应也带来了针对技能和HDD化的很多限制，然而最致命的还是Lily Rank了，满值100的Lily Rank，两个角色站在一起使用技能，Lily Rank+1，只+1！这一部作品可是有着22名角色之多，全角色刷满Lily Rank，其所需要消耗的时间和精力之多简直令人发指。Lily Booster芯片在本传作品中一向颇为好用，在本作中竟然被完全删除了。
故，不推荐以全成就为目标游玩本作，因为比本传作品要多花费好几倍的时间，而在这个过程中你会完全丧失游戏乐趣。身为外传作品本不该要求太多，但这喂屎系统满满的恶意实在让人不吐不快。
最后想说，Resta是真的萌，毒舌暴击Noire太精彩。没想到玩了好几部超次元海王星系列作品，竟然在外传里遇到最喜欢的角色，遗憾的是可能不会在其他作品中再见到Resta了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198279932844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1491131480}
review: 超女神信仰诺瓦露，黑国人的首选rpg，新颖的战棋模式,可爱的q版形象，以及完美的还原了前几作的技能。更是加入了在anime上购买家具？解答国民们的问题？新的武将？豪华的声优整容？总而言之，海王星赛高，诺瓦露prprpr

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 15110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14475, 'last_played': 1491129685}
review:
A tactical combat game set in the Gamindustri universe. This time around  you play as Noire, not Nepture, the battle are tactical, and the charactesr are chibi-style during the main game. Otherwise, if you’ve played the previous games, you will likely enjoy this one as well. A warning, the Lily achievements are even more grinding than anything in the other games. 

On a side note, I really want to buy the chibi-style characters as figures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050389259', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1490418783}
review:
STEAM上的所有海王星游戏都买了并通了所有结局，唯独这作没通关，我这个从来没写过评测的人都忍不住出来点个差评。
1.[b]男主[b]
2.[b]极其差劲的优化！货真价实的显卡杀手。[b]
我之前的显卡是GTX560，玩激黑的时候给烧坏了！坏了！战斗卡的不行，连装备界面都卡的不行！还会出现花屏显卡无响应的情况甚至死机重启。陪我征战多年的560就死在了这款游戏上，没想到，你挺过了爹3爹4孤岛3这类显卡杀手的攻势，却死在了这个地雷上。现在换了750TI，本来想通关就删，结果还是花屏死机显卡无响应，我没勇气再玩下去了。除了玩激黑外任何游戏玩着都没异常情况，也不知道是不是地雷社针对我的电脑。
目前电脑配置：
操作系统: windows 7 
处理器: Amd Phenom(tm) II X6 1055T Processor 2.80GHz
内存: 8 GB RAM
显卡:NVDIA GeForce GTX 750ti

author: {'steamid': '76561198073332210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2534, 'last_played': 1506470794}
review:
Juego bastante divertido de principio a fin, muy buen juego de estrategia con mecanicas que por lo menos yo no habia visto antes, como daño por caida y mucho juego con alturas y plataformas, musica genial.
La historia es muy buena y muy divertida, no solo por la manera en que esta escrita, sino por la forma en la que los personajes reaccionan a ella, hace buen uso de topicos burlándose de ellos en el proceso y ademas tiene diversas referencias a muchos videojuegos y cultura "friki".
Solo hay una parte que no me convence. Los personajes estan muy bien hechos y algunos sino todos son mas interesantes que el cuarteto protagonista, pero se les deja demaciado de lado en la historia y solo aparecen en momentos puntuales o sus "capitulos". 
Historia: 9/10
Jugabilidad 8/10
Sonido: 9/10
Personajes: 22 Waifus/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085747380', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1502415910}
review:
Gosta da série Hyperdimension? gosta de RPGs táticos como Firem emblem(meu favorito)? então esse jogo vai lhe agradar bastante, trust me, mas precisa saber mais sobre o jogo antes de decidir comprar ou não? bem,permita-me lhe dizer um pouco do game, esse spin-off de hyperdimension com rpgs táticos traz uma ideia totalmente diferente do que dos games originais, a partir do momento que você vê que é um rpg por turno parece a mesma coisa,mas ai você vê que desta vez Noire é que é a personagem principal, desculpa Neppy, não é sua vez hojé, no entanto, com a Noire como principal da história, você acaba vendo um lado novo da deusa Noire e junto com um grupo novo de personagens,no caso os generais das nações, e você acaba sendo um personagem no jogo também, como um secretário de Noire.
 A historia começa quando as 4 deusas estão lutando em gamemarket pelo controle, após Noire derrotar as outras 3 deusas, Noire acaba sendo enganada por um mulher chamada Eno já que Noire queria trazer a paz sem precisar lutar, e como resultado de ser enganada,Noire perde seu poder e como resultados adicionais as outras deusas também, após uma briga e discussão,fica decidido que as deusas tenham que se unir e juntar todos os generais devolta a sua equipe para então derrotar Eno, e sim, espere 4th wall breakings e referencias a outros games que vão de metal gear,Dragon quest,Street Fighter e etc
 Em questão de combate, o jogo traz a formula de Fire emblem e OOOOOooooohhhh BBBBooooooyy,se você já jogou algum FE pode terminar de ler aqui porque já sabe como vai ser o resto agora....pelo menos sería isso que eu diria se não tive-se algumas coisas adicionais que fazem com que o estilo mude sempre em quase todo mapa que você poderá visitar em missões ou história,o que pode incluir armadilhas,caixas,andares,plataformas de movimento,areas de dano,mais armadilhas,debuffs e ainda mais armadilhas,o que pode fazer com que apenas 1 personagem seu demorar 4 turnos para ir a um lugar em que o inimigo pode chegar em 1,já que eles não são afetados por isso,mas isso não faz você desistir,mas sim aprender que vilões não jogam pelas regras(n acredito que escrevi isso),com também o fato de que durante as batalhas se 2 personagens estiverem 1 do lado do outro,elas se beijaram podendo reduzir o custo de abilidades ou aumentar o dano,além de aumentar o lily rank de cada respectivamente.
bem,tem muita mais coisas no game,mas deixarei que você descubra por você mesmo,não sou muito de escrever Reviews,mas tento deixar 100% da minha opinião presente e dizer que se você quiser,compre ou espere alguma sale e compre,mas só se você curtir tanto hyperdimension ou Fire emblem ou qualquer RPG tático,só não liguem muito pro fan service.................quem eu quero enganar,vocês querem o jogo por isso né? -qq

author: {'steamid': '76561198269556450', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5413, 'last_played': 1483686673}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire é um jogo spin-off da série Neptunia que em mais uma vez em spin's mudou de gênero, agora ele é um RPG de estratégia com o estilo de personagem chibi. 
     Bom, o jogo é bem feito, temos muitas coisas a se analisar...uma delas é que o jogo tem muitas regras, por exemplo...dependendo da altura em que o seu personagem está inflige diretamente no dano, cada atributo(fogo,gelo,ar e eletricidade) tem suas vantagens e desvantagens, tanto em dano quanto em em coisas pelo cenário(baús por exemplo), o uso de skills...se vc estiver perto de alguma personagem ele da mais dano e enche uma barrinha no canto superior direito que serve pra usar o EXE DRIVE(esse chamado de Sp. Movie), tem coisas que te dão vida pela fase, etc etc(pode parecer mt coisa...mas com o tempo você decora)...e o bom que jogo faz questão de explicar tudo isso, ao começo de cada fase da missão principal a Histoire vem e te explica o objetivo e se tiver alguma coisa ela fala sobre tambem, oque é ótimo ver o trabalho que eles tiveram pra fzr isso. E outra o jogo ta bem difícil, não é tão fácil assim, tem batalhas bem complicadinhas.
     Sobre a história, bom não tem muito oque falar ele é até um pouco clichezinha, o jogo se passa em um outro universo esse chamado de Gamemarket, e começa com a Noire finalmente ganhando a Console War, após isso aparece uma personagem misteriosa(óóóóóó qm será? será que é a Airfore, ngm sabia não Compile Heart...ngm sabia) se apresetando como Eno(é a Airfore kkj) e dps um papinho na Noire de unificar as nações, ai obviamente ela passa a perna na Noire e rouba as Shares...depois disso a Noire sem shares e fraca sem poder nem usar HDD é atacada por monstros, ai que entra nosso novo protagonista, sim novo...o protagonista agora é um homem esse primeiramente apelidado de "Player" passa a energia share pra Noire, acreditando nela...após isso a Histoire vem e fala pra ela que as shares de todas as nações foram perdidas e os generais(as novas personagens) de cada nação estão a solta sem ninguem pra comanda-los e fazendo oque eles bem entendem, então o objetivo do jogo passa a ser, recuperar as Shares, reunir os generais e achar a Eno(eu ja disse que é a airfore?) junto de seu novo amigo(Noire com amigos? -Sim) agora apelidado de "Secretário"(e sim, ele particpa ativamente na história). Bom, sobre as novas personagens, elas são basicamente referências de vários jogos famoso, caso vc conheça vai reconhecer na hora, e elas são muuuuito legais, eu gostei de cada uma delas e a cada final de ep tem uma cena especial com cada uma delas, essas que geralmente são ecchis e ainda pode-se conseguir mais cenas especiais delas que são desbloqueadas aumentando o lily, esse que agora se aumenta usando os skills perto das personagens(os "pecks"). Ainda tem os minigames que se realizam la no Basilicom, vc pode decorar a basilicom com pontos que vc ganha no mercado, você pode responder cartas enviadas dos cidadãos...como você é o secretário dela, você tem que reponder da melhor forma possivel e ainda da pra ver algumas cenas especiais lá.
     A última coisa a se falar são os bugs, esse que acontecem frequentemente principalmente oque ocorre em todos os jogos da série mas aqui é mais frenquente, que é a inteligência artificial desligar, ela desligando faz com que o turno não passe e você tenha que desligar o jogo, creio eu que acontece porque a inteligência artifical é mt boa(eles procuram te cercar e tambêm procuram os personagens com vida mais fácil pra atacar), a dica que eu dou e que a própria Histoire fala é...salvar o jogo toda vez que você voltar pro Lobby principal. Mais uma dica é você sempre antes de começar uma batalha você analisar bem os inimigos.
E mais uma coisa, genuinamente nesse video-jogo a Noire é a melhor personagem(desculpa Nep-Nep ;-;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057219226', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 4764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2727, 'last_played': 1481487455}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire is a typical cheaply made srpg packed with all the cliches of the genre. Buy it in case of you're satisfied everything with NepNep & co (might want to consider buing also unlock cinematics dlc). Otherwise what awaits you is a game with worst writing of the series where the actual game consist of repetitive maps filled with cheating enemies that play with very different rules to compensate completely missing AI. Occasional super moves that come out of the nowhere might be tolerable but the thing that enemies ignore rules of floor tiles and stand idly if they can't attack player within current turn, leaves the strategic experience very lacking.

What boggles me most is why they didn't bother to fix looping of bgm tracks... Now the music ends and starts abruptly and it is very audible. Why????

author: {'steamid': '76561198091844152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2343, 'last_played': 1471114262}
review: Well Noire/Black Heart is my waifu, so obviously I'd recommend this game. If you want a serious review, this is basically a spin off of your average Neptunia game. Instead of the normal turn based RPG, you have something pretty similar to what I would relate to Fire Emblem. If you liked playing Fire Emblem, you're going to have more fun than what I've seen from other reviews. I'd enjoyed it personally because obviously waifu,waifu waifu, <3 and the events with Noire/Black Heart and the Secretary (aka you). One of my favorite scenes is the love triangle, I won't spoil it though. One more thing I would like to rant about is that the Noire from Hyperdimension and Ultradimension are DIFFERENT. I'm tired hearing people say they dislike Noire, but don't say specifically which Noire. Yes, they're pretty similar but the minor differences do make a difference, they're 2 different Noires/Black Hearts in seperate dimensions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043575278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1481334201}
review:
TL;DR -> Buy this game if you are both a fan of the series and a fan of SRPGs.

Let me start by saying that Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart is a good SRPG. It's not mindblowing, it plays like any SRPG out there, but its loveable characters and art style makes it stand out a little bit.
HOWEVER.
It could've been polished a lot.

- Sound tracks loop BADLY. You can tell whenever the track ends and starts over after a second delay, and that happens for every track.
- The "Cutscenes" animation is better than any of the RE;Birth games, making use of more movement and special effects, but the moving mouths are a pink pixelated mess.
- Humor is not there. It's not remotely as funny as other Neptunia games.
- Plot is boring and lazy. Noire as a lead character works even worse than Nepgear.

And it has its fair share of BS: enemies at low health are set to spam their EXE every turn. EVERY TURN! Not to be that guy that goes like "That's not fair!" but that's not fair. One is enough to oneshot any character it hits, there is absolutely no reason to make them go IDKFA.
Also, I DESPISE Sim Noire. It would've been good if some form of multiple choice dialogue was added, so you could have SOMETHING to pick the correct answer to the requests, but no. Instead you HAVE to use a guide. You used it, don't lie.
I don't like the flirty bits with secretary san either, it's very bad fanservice made just so that Noire fans could jack off being verbally abused by Tsundere Heart. I mean, if that's your thing I'm perfectly okay with it, but I didn't care AT ALL, especially because it doesn't belong neither in a Neptunia game, nor in an SRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034308123', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1476066359}
review:
Finally, by a well-known studio who brought you the Dept. Heaven series Sting, this is a game where I can produce Chihaya on her way to top idol by getting popularity, fans, and money around the world. On this arduous journey, more and more other idols will be available to you but you don't care about that because you're playing it for Chihaya. You get to please her as usual by scraping off points from the nearest department store andusing said points by upgrading her bedroom.

Like all the previous Idolm@ster series, your enemies cheat their way so you can be sure that all of the maps will be unfair to you. Cheats like AI will ignore height damage, can't manually assign what path to take, and such. But this can be remedied by pimpimg your idols' visual, cool, and cute stats to max with equipment and then abuse burst mode during lives by pairing idols to each other while doing their dance numbers.

tldr it's shit but do it for her anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142989596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1478790193}
review: I've finished this on the vita and from what I've played so far this a very good port. Yes It's like any other tactical rpg, which isn't a bad thing in particular as the gameplay is still very fun and enjoyable. Just don't expect an amazing story but if you're a big fan fire emblem or final fantasy tactics and don't know about hdn you'll really enjoy the gameplay here. Just put it to the highest difficulty. If you're looking for another or alternative choice for a fun tactical weeb game aside Valkyria Chronicles on steam than this is still a solid option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013410553', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4619, 'last_played': 1476610638}
review:
К сожалению, steam предоставляет очень маленький объём для написания текста, поэтому здесь я ограничусь фрагментом. Кому интересна полная версия обзора, с плюсами, минусами и скриншотами по каждой части серии, прошу сюда: http://stopgame.ru/blogs/topic/76077
Помните, что любая оценка и любой обзор это чьё-то субъективное мнение/впечатление. Прошу не кидаться кака шками (да что нецензурного в этом слове? :) ), если кто-то со мной не согласен. Я готов к (и даже рад) конструктивному диалогу.
_____
Отличная игра. Несмотря на то, что это даже не номерная часть серии, а спинофф с потативных консолей. В этой части, как мне кажется, максимальный человеческий фактор. Здесь твои действия влияют на исход гораздо сильнее, чем в других играх. Здесь составление команды обретает смысл, здесь каждый ход это стратегическое движение, а не просто подошел/ударил, здесь лили ранк это важнейший инструмент игры, а не просто метка в меню с небольшим пассивным влиянием. Ты ошибаешься и теряешь бойца. Рассчитываешь действия как надо и сохраняешь всех.
Игрок здесь сюжетно как бы присутствует в игре, то есть, находится по ту сторону монитора. Странный путь, который может как понравиться, так и нет, поскольку целью этого, как достаточно четко прослеживается, были постоянные заигрывания с игроком от лица Noire и остальных. А остальных здесь больше, чем обычно водится в играх серии. 18! новых персонажей, каждая из которых отсылает к какой-то игровой серии (ну, практически каждая...). Достаточно простенький и пафосный сюжет, тем не менее, снабженный огромным числом  диалогов (открываются по мере набора лили ранга с Noire, то есть их можно пропустить). Много фансервиса, зачастую не к месту. В общем, сюжетно игра всячески пытается заигрывать на низменных инстинктах игрока, а понравится вам или нет зависит только от вас :)
_____
Оценка: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198091595412', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1603449022}
review:
It's about time that Noire gets her own game!

Our lovely Noire is, just like every other character in this game, drawn in "Chibi"-style, making the characters look cute in a way we weren't used to until now.


There is, of course, a lot of fan-service included and that's what most of us want, right?
The player is actually (more or less) part of the story, even though he has no clue at all, which is not accurate if you look at the actual player, but tolerable and we forgive this fact anyway since we have even more cute girls in here!


Everyone will find here his special team of girls and master this game!

Enough chit-chat, pay some attention to Noire, she's getting angry already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198292245609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1474789684}
review:
通过一周目以后来写评测了，海王星系列的面子还是得好评（虽然我并不是很情愿），[h1] 但是，如果你自认为属于以下几类人，建议不要购买和尝试[/h1]
1、不能忍受出现了[strike] 给你带了绿帽子的[/strike]男主的
2、想看[strike]老婆[/strike]妹妹的，因为并没有妹妹
3、想尝试海王星系列正作的，因为本作与之前毫无任何关联
4、[strike]扶涅灭诺[/strike]
[h1]下面开始认真评测[/h1]
[h1]男主[/h1]
你没有看错，一贯卖百合的海王星出现了一种名叫男主的神奇生物。他们不仅命格优秀难以猎杀，还有[spoiler]你我的waifu[/spoiler]女神的保护，让FFF团难以下手。我不反对BG向的游戏出现男主，也可以欢快地食用Fairy Fencer系列，但这里是[strike]斯巴达[/strike]海王星，男主确实不该存在啊。
为什么要开单独的一栏来控诉男主？很简单因为[spoiler]诺瓦露被攻略了[/spoiler]。差评差评差评，重要的事情说三遍。
0/10-男主在这个系列是不该存在的生物，因为太反信仰所以信仰的半分都没有给。
[h1]画面[/h1]
地雷社作品一贯不是依靠3D画面精细程度作为卖点，这次也不例外，优化依旧不太理想，如果在OP黑屏卡死请升级解码器。
对于LIVE 2D依旧无可挑剔，因为制作较晚相对重生系列有了升级，具体水平可以参考ACT U。
8.0/10-3D画面低于平均水平，2D LIVE同类领先，信仰再加半分。
[h1]情节[/h1]不涉及剧透请放心食用
本作情节并不是很优秀，由于游戏偏重于刷刷刷，主线剧情略显单薄，很难带给玩家媲美重生系列的体验。尤其是要在较短的剧情里插入成吨的人物（本次出场人物当属历代最多），以至于人物刻画不是非常突出，情节略显杂乱，节奏太快。
然而也不能全盘否定，4个[spoiler]笨蛋[/spoiler]女神闹来闹去的还是让人感到温馨，闪光点还是不少的。
7.0/10-比起重生系列让人有些失望，信仰再加半分。
[h1]人物[/h1]
人设上依然在玩梗，看到自己熟悉的梗还是会感觉挺好玩，如前文所述人物非常多，所以CG也非常多（基本一人一张），tsunako老师画的还是很用心的，好评。
然而优秀的画风不能遮掩表现的乏力，为了增加量，减少了质的投入，让人不由得有些失望，一周目以后，我依然对操控了几十个小时的人物感到陌生，这在以前是从未有过的。
而且没有妹妹。我不知道该伤心看不见她们，还是该高兴可爱的妹妹们没有遭到男主的毒手。
7.5/10-画面加分表现力减分，信仰加半分。
[h1]游戏性[/h1]
不客气地说，本作游戏体验当属历代最差。战斗元素相对单一，重复操作过多，尤其是反人类的百合度（我已经放弃了，反正这一次没有白金奖杯）很难在长达40余小时（或许可以更少，但差不多就是这样了）的游戏时间里不让人感到厌烦。因为同质化的游戏偏多，操作相对单一和套路化，本作吸引力并不是很强。4、5个小时就会让人产生疲倦感（因人而异）。
从异常状态的设置和游戏内一些功能来看，地雷社原意是鼓励玩家明智地战斗，然而事实是DLC武器包和太过复杂的技能以及过大的覆盖范围让精确的计算变得不太现实，就算可以做到，也势必会浪费大量时间得不偿失。所以这一作注定不会是一场头脑秀，而是靠刷刷刷和RMB通往胜利大门的快餐游戏。
难度梯度设置不合理，在相对快速的游戏节奏和较慢的升级速度下，大关与大关间存在着较大的难度梯度，这一点在后期体现的尤为明显。这就只能靠刷刷刷来弥补了，老实说，很让人恼火，不是吗？
取消了企划书系统，采用了类Fairy Fencer的商店制作模式。但游戏本身的缺陷，很难在正常的游戏路线下带给玩家足够的材料用来解开一部分物品，于是乎还是要刷刷刷。
总的来说，感觉像是硬生生的把一个6、7个小时就能玩够的游戏系统拖出了40个小时。如果没有足够的耐心，很难通关。
5.0/10-令人失望，信仰加半分。
综上，5.5/10，虽然我很失望，但还是给了好评，评测区这样的人似乎不少，这个价钱到底值不值，还是各位自己见仁见智吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198058572820', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3098, 'last_played': 1488071122}
review:
[h1]Don't tell Noire, but this is still my game. She just got a logo. 
- Neptune[/h1]

He de admitir que mientras me planteaba analizar el titulo no estaba seguro de si debía recomendarlo o no, pero ciertamente es que no puedo calificarlo como un juego no recomendable ya que confío en que si has entrado hasta esta sección es porque conoces el universo Neptunia y ya eres fan.

Hyperdevotion Noire es un spin-off de la saga Neptunia que abandona el (francamente excelente) esquema jugable de RPG por turnos de la saga principal para pasar a un sistema jugable de RPG Táctico, actualmente en un gran estado de forma gracias al éxito de la veterana saga Fire Emblem.
En este juego cambiamos el rol de protagonista a Noire, lo cual a pesar de ser unos personajes más queridos de la saga por sus seguidores, termina pasándole factura al título ya que la ausencia de Neptune como eje principal de las interacciones reduce mucho su calidad. Noire es buena coprotagonista, pero le falta algo como principal heroína.
También se han visto reducidas las interacciones a través de la cuarta pared, siendo sustituidas por una (cuestionable desde mi punto de vista) función del juego que emplaza al jugador como un personaje más del argumento a través del "secretario" de Noire, creando una suerte de híbrido entre RPG Táctico y Date Sim. Esto, en mi opinión, no hace sino bajarle la calidad al producto que, sumado al hecho de que ya no existe un avance de la historia mediante exploración, sino que es una escena introductoria a un combate y la escena posterior, unida al hecho de que se acabaron las charlas superfluas y las puyitas de colegueo, ahora todo es hablar sobre luchar, le restan atractivo al desarrollo tanto de la trama como de los personajes.

En lo puramente jugable el juego cumple bien su papel. Cada personaje tiene su estilo y se adapta mejor o peor a según qué tipos de misiones, además se incluye un sistema por el que las protagonistas pueden apoyarse entre ellas al usar habilidades estando juntas en formación, reduciendo el consumo de SP de la habilidad, aumentando su fuerza y subiendo el medidor Lily (que sustituye al Exe para los movimientos finales). El principal problema de esto último es lo fácil que se convierte en un sploit, haciendo que la mayoría de misiones (sobretodo contra bosses) estén mas centradas en encajar varios Lilys por turno que en una estrategia real.
En el tema de escenarios el juego lo hace mejor que la saga principal, cada escenario de la historia es único y con un tema característico (incluso si hay varios combates dentro de la misma misión el escenario varía) por lo que en este aspecto no se le puede echar en cara nada, aunque si hay que hacer mención al, por momentos, algo injusto sistema enemigo, donde da igual que tipo de enemigo y trampa haya en el escenario, estos son inmunes a sus efectos, haciendo algunas fases largas y tediosas al no permitirse más movimiento que en "L" ([url=http://i.imgur.com/YFJfMoD.jpg]ejemplo de frustración máxima[/url]).

Por último para no alargarme mucho, el apartado gráfico se caracteriza por un estilo chibi de los personajes y una vista cenital, no abundan los detalles pero cumple su cometido y, aunque a primera vista pueda echar para atrás, casa con el conjunto y hace una experiencia agradable.
En cuanto a la parte "argumental" del titulo se han mejorado los modelos que se utilizaban en los títulos anteriores y se ha añadido más dinamismo de movimientos durante las conversaciones, así como unas transformaciones de las diosas más fluidas.


En general si te gusta el universo Neptunia te recomiendo que pruebes el título, como poco aprenderás nueva información sobre los Shares, si por el contrario eres nuevo en la franquicia, mejor prueba primero la saga principal pues este título tienes más posibilidades de echarte atrás que de engancharte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276383313', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1479143436}
review:
game is fun but one thing i don't like about this is this game lock at 30fps with 16:9 1080p ratio
if you have a wide screen monitor like mine 34inch 3440x1440,then you are out of luck.the only resolution that can scale properly is 1920x1080 without leaving the black bar.i have so much problem with this game and i constantly seen graphic lag in game.but i manage to finish the game and get norm ending.and the pathetic side is this game and all other neptunia game never get patch i mean come on ,i am rolling a gtx1080 and it sould not be an issue for graphic lagg here that occured randomly. seriously though,im runing a beast of a machine here and never once the game crash on me.......ithink that is a good thing
cause it support my xeon e1230 v5 very well.
the only thing i find it annoying in game is the dialog
it's patheticly slow on animation.....and all the HDD cpu voices stays normal like when they are human form which is i don't like.purple heart,black heart must sound mature but not in this game.
the pros are the chibi character is well design and i never once change any weapon and still using the ol dlc one.the dlc is pricier than the game but it is optional and the last boss is a pushover.
anyway if you like srpg,you can get disgaea PC.rather than this.although i can say this is the shortest game of the series if you don't plan to grind through sub quest.
but if you do want to get true ending then you have long way to grind and raise lily rank to 70 with each character which is to boring to be honest.
i would recommend this game if your are fan on the series even if a spin off.....it is quite decent for the price and challenging at the end of the chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081780579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1465817391}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart non è il capolavoro del genere e tanto meno vuole esserlo. Tuttavia è un tattico più che discreto, veloce e dinamico, particolarmente indicato per i neofiti o per i veterani che vogliono distendere i nervi con un titolo semplice, ma allo stesso tempo accattivante. Il tutto condito con fanciulle sexy e un comparto tecnico gradevole.
Un lavoro che fa del fan service ossessivo il suo marchio di fabbrica, così come i vari Neptunia, potrà fare la gioia degli estimatori dei prodotti di Idea Factory.

Recensione completa: http://www.truegamers.it/hyperdevotion-noire-goddess-black-heart-recensione/

author: {'steamid': '76561198021199823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4456, 'last_played': 1468445723}
review: Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart -  интересный эксперимент для этой франшизы. Если все остальные игры представляли собой классические JRPG (данная игра и Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed не считаются), то эта преподносит нам тактическую пошаговую RPG с богиней Ластейшена - Ноар в главной роли. Кому-то это придётся по душе, кому-то нет. О самой игре - имеется 22 играбельных персонажа (считая 4 богинь); посредственный сюжет, никак не относящийся к оригинальным играм трилогии Re:Birth и MNVII; нехитрый геймплей со своими фишками (от построений персонажей будет зависить ваш урон и т.п.); продуманные и интересные сюжетные миссии и большое количество побочных заданий, если вдруг захочется подкачать персонажей; SIMNoire - симулятор обустройства комнаты Ноар, а так же помощь ей же в ответах на всевозможные запросы от граждан; куча планов для крафта и куча достижений для гринда. Фанатам серии и просто людям, которым нравятся пошаговые RPG определённо стоит опробовать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043569804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1468020095}
review:
Two of my favorite game series, Disgaea and Hyperdimension Neptunia, combined into one gameplay style? The potential of this game was easily off the charts gameplay-wise, but...
Honestly, I'd give this a neutral review if I could. It isn't that it's bad but... the combination of these two gameplay mechanics are surprisingly subpar, both of these combined somehow managed to not be equal to each game individually.
Now that doesn't mean I hate the game as a whole, but... there's one thing included in this game that irritates me to my core; the player. Our self-inserted character without a voice... I get that this is pretty much fan-service, but I personally despise lackluster personality-less self-inserts with a passion, not to mention that the player is constantly tagging along in their adventures even when he was given a job specifically to work at Lastation Basillicom as a secretary. A secretary is not an adventurer, but it seems no-one paid attention to this small enormous detail.
I'm sorry, but there must always be one rotton apple in the bushel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247869032', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1467481492}
review:
通关感受
①秘书官很正直，不像FFF男主那样话多和三观不正，秘书官给我一种士道的感觉，特别是为了保护诺瓦露挺身而出，被假诺瓦露连砍数刀差点死掉，很是感人。
②神诺瓦性格是糟糕一点，但是你们说神诺瓦是超诺瓦的下位替换，我就很不服。
③战斗系统十分有趣，比以前玩魔界战记和风色幻想系列更有SLG的感觉，地形补正，高度补正，方向补正机关，花式通关条件，箱子叠叠高，SLG该有的都有，没有的也有，简直不能再赞。
④这一作感觉出场角色比以往都多，百合值替代EXE的方式十分有趣。
⑤剧情还是和以往一样无聊，召集伙伴打BOSS拯救世界233。
⑥信件系统很有趣，有些信件糟点十足。
⑦福利十足.....
⑧通关速度快，只做主线就行，感觉剧情奇短（40场战斗左右）。
⑨白金难度高，看到那百合度成就我就懵逼了，通关才40%的成就完成率，估计得再肝个几十小时才能白金，不过和ACTU和RB1一样，不需要开二周目，SL大法就能白金了吧，没什么强行需求二周目的奖杯，也不会像RB2和3一样容量不够，做不齐角色开不了结局。

我给满分10/10
不能再赞，玩之前本来因为秘书官想给差评的，但是秘书官太正直感动了我

author: {'steamid': '76561198010452143', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 7098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7098, 'last_played': 1467279411}
review:
[h1]Story.[/h1]
Noire plays the protagonist with the backstory as the leader of a nation of power, gaining surrounding territory under it's banner, and warring with other nations that as well are warring with other nations. [spoiler] Take all the things [/spoiler]

The game establishes/hints that this is not the original world Gamindustri but Gamarket, the CPU's have never met outside a battlefield, and the main antagonist had yet to make herself known.

The story takes a turn where Noire's good intentions lead the world into chaos, following a strangers advice to make a wish on a Sharacite rock to unite the world which [spoiler] *plothole* [/spoiler] somehow removes all the population of her city and replaces them with monsters.

Somehow drained of all strength/faith she is attacked by the weakest monster in the series, is about to accept death and get dead. x_x. [spoiler]Slime fetishes, ahoy[/spoiler] But, oh shi-, someone was in transit to the town after everyone mysteriously wrote themselves out of existence.

Deus ex machina plug, the someone is "Player", and opposed to picking up a brick and clocking trash mobs he instead grabs the hand [spoiler]( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)[/spoiler] of the broad (noire) and leads her to safety. One monologue later, Noire's faith is restored.

The fodder mobs catch up, Noire pulls her head out from between her cheeks and proceeds to do what noire usually does. After the stabbening, she clues "Player" in on her being the CPU of this nation.

After a session of "Player" feigning retardation, he explains he came looking for a jerb, Noire offers "Player" a jurb, and he hurk a durr. Now he is "Secretary".
Thus the story to [strike]dominate[/strike] [strike]save[/strike] Unite the world begins.

[h1]Gameplay.[/h1]
Hyper Devotion Noire is a Strategy RPG where you move along a grid and proceed with the turn based combat.
Enemies drop 1-2 (3?) varied items under certain conditions/luck.
Chests are over a majority of the maps
Elemental Chests open to 1 of 4 element affix attacks. [spoiler]Rock, Paper, Scissors[/spoiler]
Aquire and fight as characters you unlock progressing throughout the story. 22 in the main game. 26 w/ DLC.
Destructive and humorous - ultimates and abilities.
Resta, Poona, Wac... God tier, Carpet bomb, Aoe. Hot damn. [spoiler]Poona Ult \(^o^)/[/spoiler]
[b]For a strat rpg, it plays pretty good.[/b]
The main story feels pretty well tuned. You don't have to venture off the beaten path to grind xp between most of the main missions.
The difficulty curve seems to make a dick move when you get to the very end. The 'enemy' attacks twice in one turn. Wipes out half your team after each turn. You spam revival items/spells and use 1 heavy hitter.
You beat them. OH THIS [spoiler]ISNT EVEN MY FINAL FORM[/spoiler] Should have been expected. 10 levels higher than previous. Kills everyone in 1 turn... Go grind, scrub. [spoiler]..!.[/spoiler]
*Note, even at 99 in best gear. Some still get killed in 1 cycle, because the game says so.


[h1]Overworld[/h1]
2 mission lists to go through.
 Mission list - Story missions followed by optional missions.
 Simulation - Repeat past Story missions
You can complete each mission 2-3 times for different plans/items. The mission's will never have plans hidden in chests, only materials to make them.
Basilicom - Sim noire.
-Guess the right answers and buy all the upgrades for an added cutscene to the ending.
-Gold sink/added goal.
Item Dev. - Use drops to make useitems or [spoiler] Farm your life away [/spoiler] to make weapons and armor and rings, Oh my. And cpu suits.
CPU hotel - View cutscenes gained through lily ranks of acquired generals or unlocked past events, music, and photos.
[b]The side tasks can get reaaaally grindy.
But the slapstick, story/cinematics, goofy side shenanigans are the main reason I get IF games.[/b]


[h1]Other mentions[/h1]
Attempting 100% getting all the plans and crafting them is made to be an extreme time sinking chore. 2nd to last optional mission 10 times for 10x of 1 thing. Countless of the last 4 for a majority of the end stuff. It gets repetitive really quick.
The lily rank achievement's are an unapologetic, waving of the middle finger in your face, kinda task. Math - 23 characters total: choose 1 character, have them buff while circled by 4 others, repeat 100 times, now another set of 4 until all 22 are at 100 rank with that character. 22 Left, choose 1 character repeat, repeat, repeat until all are done.
Completing the mission animation, selecting a mission with atleast 5 slots, leaving one enemy left alive, and starting the cycle. 120 seconds (2m).
Casting 100 buffs with the center character. 10 seconds from turn start, buff, to next turn start. 1000 seconds (16m 40s)
6 cycles for the 22-21, 5 for 20-17, 4 for 16-13, 3 for 12-9, 2 for 8-5, 1 for 4-2.
71 Full cycles of 1120 seconds = 79520 seconds (22h 5m 20s)
22 hours.
Whoever is in charge of the goofy background shtick for what you can do in this game for achievements [spoiler]I don't care for you. [/spoiler] It's asking for far too much.

I was kinda thrown off that their DLC as weaponry/armor being best in slot for every character. They haven't done that before with nep games. Even when their was item DLC in prior nep games, it was a whoopin stick that you could replace with an actual item in the game making the DLC non mandatory to achieve that level of strength.
Differently balanced characters? Yes, but thats added playable content, maybe with a scene scheme or 2. Recolored weaponry with the best stats? That threw me for a loop. Usually not the norm.

That aside.
Strategy RPG. Feels like it should be a handheld game. Ported from a handheld game. Makes sense.
The matches can drag on for an excess amount of time. Some of the missions are guantlets of 2 - 4 matches before clearing. The quick save feature is nice.
Nothing against the game in all it's glory. I've had a bias against Grid based RPGs (some can do it poorly), but since IF Nep series took a stab at this genre, I was willing to jump in and it didn't suck.
Even with that, I still dont care for the genre. You move a 'piece' at a time, prep the placement, hand over the turn, wait for each npc to pingpong the camera about and each do a thing individually. Repeat till goals complete. It only feels like a chore when its a long winding path, with bridge triggers, that takes moving 7 people through a dozen turns to get from a - b.

They didn't do anything wrong, but there is definately room for polish in the system, even in a completely different area like the cinematics and sound.
The layers in the faces of the characters animation cycle bleed through their masks, so you'll see the top and bottom of a 2nd eye hole/lid/lash thats just set to blink when they're staring.
Or when closed you can see the white of the eyes bleeding through the edge of the lid mask.
The music was not cut to loop seemlessly - it's just a jarring stop and start over.
Would be nice if some of the settings worked properly too, like windowed mode. You must drag to resize the window manually everytime you start the game. The screen resolution option does nothing. Windowed startup will always default to 1280x720.

But yea, it's a port. So.. fuck it. Yeah? Forgiven.

Cons.
-Minor polish issues.
--Dick move at the end curve.
-Windowed screen resolution presets do not work.
--A reason to hate achievements.
-A lack of plutia

Fun facts. You can forcibly crash the game by toggling Tiara's HDD mode in the characterinfo screen.

Pros.
-Nep game
--Decent combat system
-All the shenanigans that comes with neptune games.
--Decent adventure/story
-5 decent dlcs
--Blanc's Rage

It's pretty good. Go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150677045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1507171852}
review: This is a really cute game! Seeing the Neptunia francise through the eyes of its most notorious tsundere has been a real joy, both in terms of story and gameplay. Though the writing seems a bit weak at some points, the characters themselves are just as memorable as in the main games. Furthermore, I really dig the strategy rpg combat system they created, which reminds me a bit of FIRE EMBLEM and similar titles. Overall, I consider this to be one of my favorite games by Idea Factory to date!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042631493', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1488754168}
review:
Honestly didn't like the game much until the other CPU's showed up.
Story wise, Noire is probably the most annoying character to have be the main character, her normal tsundere ways are more tsun than ever, you'll tsun miss the games where Neptune was the main. I have never in my life wanted to tell an anime representation of a game console to shut up more than when Noire speaks.

Outside of that, the overall story isn't terrible, and the other CPU's are cool as always. Gameplay is interesting and although slow paced, its enjoyable. 

One more thing. Vert is OP...how you a quarter stack of chibi....but you a full stack of fanservice? When Vert gets a game, I'm preordering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043857990', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3863, 'last_played': 1466099547}
review:
[h1]Best girl in the game = best game?[/h1]

Highly anticipated by some, though not everyone. Here's the second Neptunia spin-off featuring the lovely tsundere goddess Noire. Is the game worthy of having her name in the title? Well...

The game already came out a year ago on PS Vita with mixed reviews at the time, and for good reasons too. Now it's time to see how well it does on PC.

[b]The Positive[/b]

[list]
    [*]Noire is the protagonist this time around. The game's setting - an alternate universe, with Noire's city being the center of attention.
    [*]Hyperdevotion Noire is not a typical JRPG, a Strategy RPG rather. Similiar to Fire Emblem and Final Fantasy Tactics gameplay wise.
    [*]Once you get the game running properly (more on that later), it runs rather smoothly, can be set to FULL HD resolution.
[*]New characters associated with Lastation, that are based off playstation titles (Solid snake never looked so full-o-melons). CGs included of course.
[*]An interesting minimode featuring Noire and secretary dealing with the requests of the people. Silly dialogue, Ho!
[/list]

[b]The Neutral[/b]

[list]
 [*] Typical to Neptunia series, a lighthearted Save-the-world plot, which is mostly just an excuse to see cute girls interacting with one another.
[*] Noire is accompanied by Secretary - the faceless, nameless, self-insert (male?) player character. Some part of the Neptunia community are very put off by this. "Noire, romancing a [strike]male[/strike] character? Outrageous."
[*] Interesting Chibi (small and deformed) depictions of characters instead of typical full-size 3D models.
[*] On a technical side, there is a 30fps cap. Might not be a problem to everyone of course.
    [*] As common with Neptunia games in general, it's not fully balanced. Don't be surprised to be wiped by a single +5lvl enemy.
[*] DLC for each character's best weapon to plow through the game fast, DLC for 4 extra characters (no events beside their missions sadly), DLC to unlock all events (that you'd need to grind for otherwise). I guess they are ok if you value your time more than your wallet.
[/list]

[b]The Negative[/b]

[list]
    [*]Hyperdevotion Noire launched with numerous game-crashing bugs, with some not fully fixed till now: Crash during video cutscenes due to lack of certain codes |fixed?|, occasional crashing when selecting Disc Dev option due to denied memory access bug |maybe fixed|, sudden sound disappearances followed by performance drops fixed only by restarting the game. Some bugs are fixable thanks to the community, which is a relief.
    [*]Most of the soundtrack is re-used from previous games, though not a problem to newcomers, fans might feel a bit dissapointed.
	[*]Gameplay specifics: Fall damage, booby traps and such affect your team, doesn't affect the enemies at all. Probably due to bad AI, the dev team were probably too lazy to make enemies smart enough to avoid traps.
    [*]To get to the true ending and unlock optional 1-2 hours long extra dialogue between characters a 2 hour "Lily rank" grind is required. It's dull, and sadly not entertaining to do. Of course, you can unlock the events with a DLC, though then the question raises, why would you make the grind so tiring in the first place?
[*] Completionists should be prepared for another grindfest. just like with NepU, you'll spend at least more than 15 hours grinding for achievements. Make sure to ingest so Zombrex on the way!
[/list]

[b]Conclusion[/b]

Hyperdevotion Noire: GBH on the surface is a good addition to the Nep series, with a colorful cast, more wacky dialogues between them, more references, and more plump bouncy...content. Sadly, compared to the other games in the series, the gameplay is quite slower due to it being a Turn Based RPG. Those wishing to complete the game fully might have a bad time grinding.
Should you get the game? To the devoted fans of the franchise I say - sure. If you're not, you might want to consider looking for alternatives or waiting for a discount before trying this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262496475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1593640737}
review:
It's a SRPG. Strategy, and RPG, and by FAR the most "detailed" of the neptunia series. Seriously, Compile Heart can only learn from this game's design.

Let's start from the basic: Strategy is deep. Deeper than the mainline neptunia series, anyways. Thinking about your moves a few turns ahead is never a bad idea, and probably will save a good bit of headache on hard difficulty. Plus, with the myriad status effects, the character EXE drives have never been more varied than now.

Then there is the RPG: On one hand, the stat levels are finally crunched down to manageable numbers, and leveling is blessedly slower, you remain in the "sweet spot" of challenge level for much longer than in the main series. On the other hand, Itemization has never been better: Blanc has at least two equally viable builds: Paladin and Warrior, depending on which hammer you use. One focuses on tanking damage and throwing out support via knockback and perfect defense, the other just straight out goes for the hurt, sacrificing SP and agility for big blows. Similar choices in weaponry are there for all other CPUs, allowing for more diverse gameplay than ever.

To top it all off, our poorly-done ingame avatar even gets choices to pick in Sim Noire while reading requests. What is this if not a beginning of multiple choice conversations?

On the negative side of that, is that this relatively large freedom of narrative choice isn't translated into the main story line, or some of the "cutscenes" after the requests are read, so we aren't at the point of a true RPG yet (let's say, like Ultima) and I personally disagree with some of my supposed avatar's choices, but that's really a side-issue.

I do recommend this game, I do recommend it on hard difficulty, because there will never be a boring moment of it that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082755441', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1464999740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093711899', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2677, 'last_played': 1464664511}
review:
The PSVITA version of this game was notorious for being plagued with gamebreaking bugs and glitches, many of which resulted in crashes and other nonsense that made the game almost unplayable. In the fancy new PC version of this game, all of those have been fixed. And with all of that nonsense patched up, the game is actually playable, and it's fantastic. Aside from a few minor things, this game is actually worth buying. While on sale, that is. 

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]

This game plays the same way that any other turn based strategy game would. You chose your units, and you take turns beating the livid fadoodles out of each other. The game revolves aroud the "Peck" mechanic, which basically means that when 2 or more units are right beside each other and one of them attacks, the attacker's skills will not only cost less, but do more damage as well. This does leave you vulnerable to AoE (Area of Effect) attacks, which are especially damaging in hardmode (I'm talking to you, Beam). Lily ranks are also a thing in this game, and all they do is unlock events in the CPU Hotel, increase the effects of "Peck," and are needed to unlock the good ending. They're only built by pecking and the maximum is 100. So if you want those achievements, better start grinding.

There's also an elemental cycle in this game, which consists of fire, wind, electricity, and ice. It's pretty standard, but is really confusing at first. Fire beats wind, wind beats electricity, electricity beats ice, and ice beats fire. Almost all enemies are one of these elements, with bosses and some regular enemies being the only exception. You can change the element affinities of your units by equiping crystals onto them. There are also different levels to the crystals, with larger numbers meaning that if the unit equips a higher level crystal, they will have a a larger advantage against whatever they're strong against, but a larger weakness to whatever they're weak against.

Other than those, it's your basic strategy game, with loads of different units which all have different skills, along with loads of enemies with loads of loot. The objectives of each mission is usually the standard "Kill everything that breathes," with the occasional "Defend this thing/area". Each story mission takes place in a different place, with a different gimmick, which prevents the game from getting too stale. They also throw new units at your each chapter, which also helps prevent it from getting stale. Each character references a different game series, which adds to the uniqueness of the game. However, in battle, the CPUs are absolutely broken because HDD exists, as you can pretty much stomp most enemies and bosses in the game with HDD spam. I've also seen people get mad at the 30 FPS cap, but unlike an shooter, having more frames doesn't really affect the game aside from making it look cooler, so that wasn't really a concern for me in particular.

[h1]The Story and Art[/h1]

Generic self-insert male character is generic. You see, the Nep games always tend to have good storylines, with Re;Birth 1 being an excellent example of that. However, the self-insert male makes the story significantly worse, possibly even the worst of all the Nep games. He doesn't even do anything interesting, or helpful, or anything besides giving a word of encouragment here and there. Other than that, the story is pretty good, so I'm not going to spoil anything here.

The art is drawn by Tsunako, which is always good, because Tsunako is a godly artist, who's also drawn pretty much every other Nep game out there. I personally like chibis as a whole, but when incorporated as a 3D model, they don't look nearly as appealing. I personally would have liked something similar to Fire Emblem, where you control pixel models on the map and zoom in during combat, but that's just me.

[h1]Everything Else[/h1]

Aside from those, there are also a variety of other things you can do as well. The significant ones being Sim Noire and the CPU Hotel. Sim Noire is basically a a combination between a home decorator and a mini dating simulator between Noire and Generic Anime Male #1. You can buy different pieces of furniture for your home with Sim points, which you get as a bonus for buying things at the shop with actual money. There's also the option to take up requests by the citizens of Gamarket, which is the dating simulator element of this. When you pick a request, you are granted with three possible lines to say, you click one, and watch a short conversation between Noire and Generic Anime Male #1. That's it.

The other thing worth noting is the CPU Hotel. In here, you can view events with each of the characters in the game. These events are unlocked depending with their Lily rank with Noire. These, unlike the requests in Sim Noire, aren't cringe worthy at all, but are actually quite interesting and give a bit of background information about each character and what game they reference.

Aside from those, you got the Shop, where you buy stuff. The Disk Dev, where you can burn chips into disks to equip onto your characters, which give different buffs depending on the chip. Finally, you got the Item Dev, where you make items with the loot you get from chests and dead things.

[h1]The Conclusion[/h1]

I am by NO means a decent reviewer. I just happened to type this on a whim because I like this game a decent amount. However, in my 60+ hours of laying this game, I can say with confidence that this game is totally worth buying for the reasons listed above. I am 100% sure that I am missing several important details, but there are other reviews out there, so go read those instead if you wanted something professional. That's my cue to bounce, for this review is over now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032267009', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1480477684}
review:
The Hyperdimension Series made by Idea Factory are one of the only series that I have played more than just 1 game of.
Eg: Saints row 3, Final Fantasy, etc.

I would have to say the Hyperdimension Franchise are the most intriguing out of all I have played.
It breaks the 4th wall too much, its hillarious, its awesome, etc.

Basically the only series I haven't just given up on right after playing just 1 of the sequels or prequels.

10/10 nep nep would break the 4th wall again.

It's just weird having the CPU's world change wayyyy too often. Gamarket, whatever was before, etc.
I was expecting a sequel of the previous but as Noire for the MC.
But what did I get? Something much, much better and very kawaii.

If you have any other recommendations that you think are better than the Hyperdimension Franchise, please recommend because this game has gotten me more into Singleplayer games than any other games had. I used to be a MMORPG gamer but now I'm just a casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167172560', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1464626875}
review:
序章我还挺期待的……结果到了第一章冒出来个[h1]男主[/h1]！初战打完直接荣升诺瓦露御用秘书这展开比龙傲天爽文还快！=_ =#

说好的海王星卖百合呢！而且这男主直接是玩家第一人称代入的名字都没！反正我是无法想象数千数万的肥宅同时代入诺瓦露BF预定这一设定（

王八蛋地雷社你还我百合魂！还我百合魂！

*PS4：游戏性就不提了，反正初战打完后面的我也玩不下去了……DLC一打勾这个游戏剩下有意思的也就只有tsunako老师的画和声优们了……

[spoiler]（我不记得之前有没有说过，早在海王星wikia里面就翻到过诺瓦露曾经有人妻身份出场的FanDisc，老公身份也是没有提及……反正地雷社你爱怎么玩怎么玩吧这口狗屎我不吃 凸(艹皿艹 )）[/spoiler]

========更新========

冷静一晚上，我来说说为什么对这次加入男主如此反感……

同为地雷社作品，FFF就是男主视角，但是因为系列本身就能看出来是BG向所以并没有什么问题，该推的妹子还是推……而海王星不说RB了从原作无印开始就是一直没有男主的全女性阵容，何况通过游戏剧情可以判断是向着卖百合的方向走而不是类似偶像式的角色单卖。

而这一次突然冷不丁冒出来一个男主，虽然历代海王星都是各自独立的平行世界，也就是说即使本作/这个世界里有个男主推诺瓦露，但其实并不影响其他世界的剧情发展也不影响之后的新作。然而如果现在告诉你LL出新企划讲μ's成人后的人妻生活和他们的老公，拉拉人会受得了么=_ =#道理都是一样的

作为系列首次加入男主的设定，没有足够的世界观铺陈和男主介绍冷不丁这么塞进去，而且还在初战之后就以迅雷不及掩耳之势加好感度，论剧情质量虚的跟低质GAL差不多还没以前几作好，论销售策略这基本上让所有继续期待百合的玩家都给打了一记耳光——哪怕之后该prpr的prpr该百合的百合，诺瓦露已经不是妹子们的女神而是人妻了……

author: {'steamid': '76561198017087470', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1508356448}
review:
A very simplistic strategy based in the Nep universe, Very easy (too easy) not really meant for fans of the strategy genre but instead for fans of the Nep games.
This is a fan service game complete with a silent self insert character with the focus really being on Noire rather than the in-game world.

If you havent played a Nep game before or ended up here from searching the strategy tag i cant really recomend this as the cast and thier humour is the main selling point not the combat.

If you have played a nep game and enjoy the series i can recommend this as its a nice change of pace from the normal playstyle of the other games....but id wait to get it on sale which being a nep game will happen almost all the time!

Ignore 90% of the dlc, Its OP armour and weapons in a game you can already face roll just get IF,Compa.Sting and Tiara

author: {'steamid': '76561198087565261', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 5214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1466398401}
review:
ภาคแยกอีกภาค (ซึ่งไม่เกี่ยวกับภาคหลัก) ของซีรีย์สงครามเทพธิดาโมเอ้แห่งโลกเกม คราวนี้พัฒนาโดยทีมงาน String และนำเสนอระบบการเล่นแบบ S-RPG (Strategy Role-Playing Game) วางตัวละคร (ยูนิต) แล้วผลัดกันเดินเป็นช่องๆ ซึ่งใครที่เคยเล่นซีรีย์ Disgaea หรือ Final Fantasy Tactic น่าจะคุ้นเคยระบบนี้ดีและเข้าถึงได้ไม่ยาก ที่สำคัญระบบชูโรงของตัวเกมที่ทำให้เกมนี้ต่างจาก S-RPG อื่นๆ คือ Lilly System การสร้างค่าความสัมพันธ์ของตัวละคร ซึ่งทำให้สกิลโจมตีต่างๆ ของตัวละครที่ยืนใกล้กัน มีประสิทธิภาพมากขึ้นด้วย

และภาคนี้นำเสนอตัวละครในรูปแบบตัว Chibi (ตัวเล็ก น่ารัก หัวโต ขาสั้น) ตั้งแต่ตัวละครเทพธิดาโมเอ้ 4 องค์ที่เราคุ้นเคย (พระแม่ Noire , Neptune , Vert และ Blanc) พร้อมด้วยตัวละครจากเกมซีรีย์อื่นๆ เช่น Vio จาก Resident Evil , Lid จาก Metal Gear , Resta จาก Record of Agarest War , Lee-Fi จาก Street Fighter และอื่นๆ อีกคับคั่ง

ตัวเกมยังมีระบบ Sim-Noire ด้วยการนำพ้อยจากที่เราซื้อไอเทมต่างๆ ในเกม มาแลกซื้อสิ่งของต่างๆ ซื้อห้อง เพื่อพิชิตใจนาง ผ่านตัวผู้เล่นที่รับบทเป็น เลขาส่วนตัว (เอาจริงๆ ระบบนี้ควรเรียกเป็นระบบจีบ Noire มากกว่า)

กราฟฟิกตัวเกมถูก Upscale จากเวอร์ชั่น PS Vita อยู่ในระดับที่สวยงาม รองรับ 1080p และซัพพอร์ตระบบจอย Xbox360 แต่ตัวเกมยังมีปัญหาทางเทคนิคอยู่ ตั้งแต่ (เอาที่ผมเจอคร่าวๆ นะ)
- Achievement ไม่ปลดในระหว่างเล่น จะปลดให้หลังจากที่เราออกเกมไปแล้ว ซึ่งคนเขียนเองหงุดหงิดกับส่วนนี้อยู่ไม่ใช่น้อย
- อาการ Game Crash ระหว่างเล่น (คนเขียนเจออาการนี้มาครั้งนึง แบบงงๆ)
- ตัวเกมในตอนนี้ ยังรันที่ 30fps เท่านั้น ไม่สามารถรันที่ 60 เหมือนภาคอื่นๆ ได้
- ตอนนี้ยังไม่รองรับระบบ Steam Cloud ทำให้บางคนมีปัญหาเซฟเกมหาย

[b][i]** สุดท้ายนี้ Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart ยังเป็นภาคแยกอีกเกมในซีรีย์ Hyperdimension Neptunia ที่สาวกไม่ควรพลาด ทั้งขาเกม S-RPG ขาเสพตัวละคร หรือขาจรที่ยังเป็นมือใหม่กับเกมแนวนี้ ซีรีย์นี้ และชื่นชอบหลงรักตัวละคร ก็สามารถลองเล่นได้ เข้าถึงได้ง่ายด้วยครับ **[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198089194217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1463170119}
review:
The Good:  A competent grid-based strategy RPG.  The CPU transformations are a unique addition, and I like they added characters based on game franchises instead of companies and consoles.

The Bad:  The trap floor tiles are really annoying, and don't seem to affect the enemies.  There's also some grinding to be done in the game.

The SaHD:  Works well with both keyboard/mouse and controller setups.  The game ran smooth with no problems on my i7-4790/16GB PC.

(I played the PS Vita version for many hours and played the PC version enough to test system stability and control configurations.)
*More in-depth reviews and more at: sahdgamer.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198212000405', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1477265871}
review:
[h1] O que é? [/h1]
Um Spin-off de RPG tático do Nepverse (Hyperdimension Neptunia  games) com a deusa que representa a plataforma de games da Sony (Playstation), a Noire como a protagonista 
Resumo da ópera , esta a mesma console war de sempre, com o diferencial que a Noire da uma sova braba nas outras 3 CPUs sozinha e dessa vez ela possui "generais" essas que são personagens baseadas em franquias de grande sucesso nos consoles de mesa ou portáteis da Sony (Street Fighter, Final Fantasy, Legend of Heroes, Resident Evil, Metal Gear Solid, etc.).  
O que acontece em seguida, Noire cai em uma armadilha que ela e juntamente as outras CPUs perdem seus "Shares" (crentes, fanboys, habitantes do seu reino, etc).  
Sendo assim, todas CPUs ficam mais fracas que as generais que logo desfazem aliança com Noire. Já encaminhando para o plot do jogo: ir investigar quem é o culpado por trás da cilada, enquanto recupera a confiança das CPUs, generais e outras personagens do jogo. 
 
[h1] Resumo [strike]para leigos[/strike] [/h1]
É um jogo bem [strike]kawaii desu de weaboo 0/10 IGN, 0/10 Gamespot 40/40 Famitsu[/strike] chibi e moe, mas é um RPG bem interessante e desafiador (eu já disse que é kawaii?).

[h1] Veredito [/h1]  
Aí esta um bom spin-off da série que não é um completo sofrimento jogar no teclado e mouse. O som do jogo é ótimo, tem bons efeitos sonoros, (que podem ficar meio repetitivos com o tempo) as músicas de fundo são as mesmas da série, ambas dublagens em inglês e em japonês são boas [spoiler]Menos a voz da Noire em inglês, não me leve a mal, Erin Fitzgerald é uma dubladora bem renomada com um currículo bem extenso na indústria e mercado de trabalho da dublagem. mas a voz da Noire, Chie do Persona 4 Golden / Arena, Agnes Oblige são uma boooooosta [/spoiler] . E mesmo sem as CPUs  Candidates (as irmãs), o jogo ser mais otimizado ANTES das das atualizações (é, eu também fiquei tipo: "WTF?!?!") e ter que baixar um pacote de codecs de vídeo pro jogo não ficar na tela cinza da morte por causa das introduções do jogo... O mesmo é bonito, engraçado, as animações de diálogo são mais fluidas do que o costume, e é bom de jogar sem o controle de XisCaixa Trezentusesessenta.

EDIT: Fiquei com tédio no trabalho e com tantas inconsistências e erros de português, achei melhor retrabalhar a analise para uma versão "mais definitiva".

author: {'steamid': '76561198123236969', 'num_games_owned': 3530, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1469300101}
review:
Коли я вперше почав грати цю гру я не знав чого очікувати, тому моє враження було wtf?!? Але чим дальше я грав тим більше вона мені подобалась.
Hyperdevotion Noire це суміш візуальної новели та рпг з покроковими боями, цікава суміш, але вона працює.
Важко виділити сильні чи слабкі сторони гри, тут скоріше ситуація коли все виконано на хорошому, якісному рівні, все гармонічно.
Сюжет, ну він для нашого брата буде просто дивним =) Але він цікавий, за рахунок дуже різнобарвних персонажів, важко передбачити що буде далі.  Коротко описати не вдасться, тому що я сам напевне маю пробіли, так як не грав у попередні ігри. Ця гра хоча не є прямим продовженням, але являється спін-офом серії в котрій інша героїня була протагоністом. 
Графічно гра не виділяється нічим, окрім сцен з діалогами, але гра виглядає приємно. 
Музика і озвучення, дуже класні. Багато голосів я впізнав з гри Hunniepop а там озвучення було однією з найсильніших сторін гри, тому і тут воно не підводить. 
Бої мені дуже сподобались, попри всю анімешність на високих рівнях складності гра стає дуже важкою. Перед нами класична гра з покроковими боями, з деякими особливостями, як маса різних статусів та ефектів, і також різні рівні ландшафту, на котрих деякі види зброю дають перевагу, а деякі втрачають свою. Головні 4 героїні, (так як загалом ігрових персонажів здається 18) мають унікальну особливість перетворюватись в богинь котрі отримують серйозний баф до статів, та крила котрі допомагають пересуватись по полю битви, але це тимчасовий ефект і разовий для кожної богині в одному поєдинку.
Всі ці особливості і неймовірна кількість різних монстрів та ворогів, дають справді приємні враження від боїв.
В грі є також система крафту, та система взаємин між персонажами. Ще є щось подібне до відповідей на листи фанатів. Де головна героїня відповідає на звернення, що дає нам змогу краще познайомитись з нею, а це відбувається в її помешканні котре нам потрібно покращувати щоб отримати додаткові інсайди в життя героїні.
Одним словом гра має дуже багато контенту, тільки головна кампанія, думаю десь на годин 25-30, є ще додаткові місії, ну і звісно всі вище написані різновиди геймплею. 
Якщо вас цікавить жанр  JRPG, якщо вам подобаються пародії та сатири на сучасну культуру, тоді ця гра вам обов'язково сподобається.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062367735', 'num_games_owned': 1462, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1461595184}
review:
El título de Sting es una experiencia irregular. En general, acierta en los aspectos jugables, como un sistema de combate que, sin innovar, divierte, para fallar en los aspectos no jugables: la forma de presentar la historia es pesada, aburrida, a veces frustrante, y esto lastra demasiado el juego. Por otro lado, el sistema creado alrededor de la base de Noire otorga cierta frescura, lo cual es de agradecer. Hyperdevotion Noire Goddess Black Heart es, pues, un juego que disfrutarán los fans de la saga y los amantes de los juegos de estilo anime, pero que muchos jugadores de RPGs tácticos encontrarán simple y monótono.

PROS
+El combate táctico es entretenido
+Música alegre y pegadiza
+La base de Noire tiene elementos interesantes

CONTRAS
-Conversaciones eternas y poco profundas
-Controles incómodos en PC
-Sin traducción al castellano

NOTA: 6

[url=http://www.gameit.es/hyperdevotion-noire-goddess-black-heart-analisis-pc/]Aquí un análisis más exhaustivo[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198076849921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1497052206}
review:
The gameplay is just awful. 
-Maps and AI are shit. No interesting objectives or enemy setups, and getting the few chests isolated in a corner is just needlessly tedious, as you don't have any pressure from anything, the enemies just nicely wait for you to get in their range before they do anything, there's no time limit, no reinforcments, absolutely nothing. You're just wasting you're time going from one part of the map to another with no repercussions to gather the chests. You don't even get any reward or incentive to finish missions faster or by minimizing damage taken or anything.
-Due to the aforementioned garbage AI, combat is always "bait one enemy by sitting at his max range then gang him up". They do nothing by themselves, and even if you "aggro" one of them their buddies just don't care and they'll wait for you to come to them to act. That is reallty mindboggling coming from Sting. How can you do this sort of shit after making Yggdra Union is beyond me. 
-No interesting options. A simple weapon triangle would've been the bare minimum instead of "normal attack, weak skill, strong skill" where you only have to watch for your SP gauge. It really feels like I'm playing a regular RPG, with all the slowness and shortcomings of a TRPG and none of the benefits.

I beat Rebirth 1 and sort of enjoyed it in a mindless, button-mashing and completionism kind of way, and I wouldn't say I recommend it, but this game doesn't even have that aspect and is just way worse.

And that's not even touching on the usual rock-bottom production value, but I didn't really have any expectations regarding that after playing Rebirth 1.

I got hard baited into buying this because I saw this was a TRPG made by Sting, but it turns out this is nothing more than a quick cash-grab with none of the parties involved giving a shit about this game. Only buy if you like nepshit
